messages: 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:59): paul_irish: Finished and landed the video engine rewrite into github. :)
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:00): Some demos that show off the correct rendering now
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:08): also high-color games no longer are slow
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:14): gfx engine isn't perfect, better drink my own piss and rewrite it from scratch. :P
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (07:21): 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2: how do i shoot in crazyzone
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (07:22): 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2: how do you handle sound ? i dont hear anything, is that normal ?
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:23): or wait until chrome fixes its sound support in a few months
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:23): no sound in IE9 because of no wav support in <audio>
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:24): and audio is buggy in chrome and opera
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (07:24): ok so you do <audio> with wav ?
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:24): because opera+chrome use my wav pcm audio fallback
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:24): 3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298: I convert the audio in real time to wav pcm
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:25): from audio buffer -> wav pcm binary string -> data uri -> audio tag
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:25): firefox 4 lets me send samples directly to the audio hardware though
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:26): and chrome's web audio to do the same thing as mozWriteAudio is broken right now (experimental about:flags thing)
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (07:26): im doing a game too and had some latency issue with it
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:26): well that's from your browser pausing every x seconds or milliseconds to decode the base64'd wav pcm data
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:27): or to encode it for that matter to the data uri format, only to decode it later
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:27): or latency just from the classical hardware DMA delay
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:27): from your browser just taking too long
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:28): generating audio realtime in a cpu emulation entirely in javascript was never supposed to be done in JS+HTML5
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (07:28): 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2: your game fullscreen looks nice.. could you do a blur to smooth the pixel effect ?
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (07:30): might be my local config tho. linux with 2 sounds card... and known issue between flash audio and normal alsa program
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:30): also, the pixelated effect is way faster, which is why I selected it
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:30): so it's firefox 4 then itself having issues with your comp
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:31): I wonder if my audio buffer is too large or small for some systems
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:31): it's not even a third of a second ling
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:32): linux drivers must hate my 70 khz audio
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:32): hipsters don't like to conform to 44.1 khz. xD
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:35): the thing is that's probably a resource loaded into memory already via src'd in
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:35): I create my audio and pass it to a func on the fly
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:36): This isn't a classic html5 app that already has audio src'd in
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:37): though the demo you linked seems to grab data via the moz audio api as well
